item.title: 19. Observability for trading systems: logging, metrics, and tracing basics
item.description: Trading systems are noisy and time-sensitive. When something goes wrong—missed ticks, delayed jobs, failed API calls—you need answers fast. Observability is the safety net: logs for context, metrics for trends, and tracing for end-to-end visibility. This post documents the baseline observability setup in this repo and how it maps to real production concerns. 1. Logging: structured, centralized, and consistent The backend uses Loguru as the primary logger, with a custom configurator to capture both Loguru logs and standard Python logging.
